headline: Slow Cooker Chicken Noodle Soup
description: This comforting chicken noodle soup is prepared in a slow cooker for ease, making it a great choice for a weeknight dinner.

video.name: How To Make Chicken Noodle Soup In A Slow Cooker

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Noodle Soup
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken, water, celery, carrot, green onion, chicken bouillon, parsley, bay leaf, seasoned salt, salt, dried basil, and pepper into the bottom of a slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low until chicken breasts are no longer pink in the centers, 5 to 6 hours.
Remove and discard bay leaf. Remove chicken, shred using 2 forks.
Return shredded chicken to the pot. Stir in egg noodles.
Cover and continue to cook on Low until noodles are tender, 20 to 30 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: This is the best chicken noodle soup I ever had. I didn’t have most of the listed herbs so I used minced onion powder and low sodium mrs dash and double the pepper. I used 2.3 pounds of chicken and 12 oz of noodles. Chicken was good at 5.5 hrs so then I stirred in the noodles and let it cook for another thirty min. I used four cups water and four cups low sod stock. The noodles were soaking up the stock so I added two more cups. I did add one teaspoon of salt for better flavor as I had omitted it initially. I served it up and added some sriracha sauce and was warm and happy. I am recovering/have the flu! Thank you for this recipe!
This was nice, but I found the broth quite bland. I’ve had better by making my own stock out of a chicken carcass then using that in place of water. With mote flavour this recipe is promising.

This was okay. I’ve had better. I followed recipe exact. Flavor was there but dull when I sipped the broth only. Maybe a good soup when you’re sick? In hindsight, should have used just broth (no water) and maybe increased other seasonings? I also blame being overcooked. Since I do not work from home, this cooked on low for almost 8.5 hours before we shredded the chicken. It then cooked another 40 min for the egg noddles to cook through. Chicken was stringy and dry. That part I blame on me as submission says 5 hours. Maybe chicken thighs if you need to let cook all day? Glad we tried. Makes a TON! Just not our favorite version. Thank you!

Slow cooker and chicken soup .. perfect. Tweaked for more flavor, by using organic chicken bone broth and soup mix for Matzo ball aoup. Carrots, onions, celery. Instead of noodles, made matzo ball from the mix . It was a hit. Do not need to cube chicken breast. Meat can be shredded towards the end. New way and easier to make soup.

This recipe is perfect, but I made substitutions based on what I had on hand and it still came out delicious. Subbed green onions for a regular onion, used 7 to 8 chicken thighs instead of chicken breast, used 1 1/2 tsp. salt and omitted season salt, 5 1/2 cups of chicken broth instead of 8 cups water, added an extra carrot, and used thyme instead of basil. It cooked for 4 hours, the small thighs cooked quicker than larger breasts. I added noodles for 30 minutes. Total cook time 4 1/2 hours on low.

This recipe was really great! 
Although I didn’t use the slow-cooker as planned. I didn’t have enough time that day so I combined followed the recipe but using a soup pot on low. I fried the chicken on low so it was still juicy and shredded it and added it to the pot. 
I cooked the noodles separately so that I could save the leftovers for another time and not have mushy noodles. 
Easy to do, was told I “outdid myself “ from my fiancé. Super hearty and great on a chilly night. We even had a frozen baked crusty bread that put the star on top. Definitely give it a try!!
The recipe states that the celery and carrot are chopped. They don't appear to be chopped in the picture. However, the soup was very good
I tried it and the soup was great, but the noodles were gummy. I have good quality noodles, and i did everything by the recipe, so not sure what went wrong
The best ever!! Sent some to my neighbor and now we are best friends!
This recipe was great. We had leftovers for 3 days for lunches and normally my husband won't eat leftovers. Loved it!
Just okay. Definitely needs more spices. Kind of bland. Very filling though. Nice thick soup. Would make again, but going to spice it up some more.

Awesome recipe! Excellent flavor as is but also extremely versatile. Throw in some extra veggies or adjust seasonings as you like. Also super easy, a true throw everything in the crock pot and forget it recipe. Kids loved it!

Hubby said no to this soup — but, I made it anyway. He is currently on his second large bowl!!! I didn’t have chicken stock, so I used Better Than Bouillon (veggie). This is a keeper. 
Thank you!!!
Great tasting, easy recipe! I substituted poultry seasoning for season salt & omitted Bay leaf & sweet basil. Great taste and mild enough for the most sensitive stomach!!
I enjoyed this easy and tasty recipe. I added some mushrooms, deleted the onions and was very satisfied with the results.
Very delicious soup, family enjoyed the flavour. Followed the ingredients and directions, turn out awesome. Will definitely make again.
It was awesome!
it was very bland
This is the only chicken noodle soup I’ll make. Want a quality chicken noodle soup with minimal effort? Want a soup that tastes like Top Quality restaurant soup? This is your recipe.
Easy and tasty, I had to sub macaroni due to being on virus lockdown... worked fine. I have lots of leftovers

I made this as written using the water. Very good soup! I love that it's homemade and has great flavors. It makes a lot of soup. I used kluski noodles to give it that perfect chicken noodle soup feel. They took 30 minutes to soften. Did I point out it's a great soup?!?
I cut the chicken into pieces at the start rather than shredding it later in the recipe. Will be making it again very soon. Great tasting recipe.
The recipe is amazing! It's so good that I volunteered to take it to a church function, and I never cook for church functions!
No changes made & YES will certainly make this dish again. Once again my family LOVED it! My daughter took some to work & gave some to her dog, who also LOVED it!!
It turned out fantastic!
Soup was great. I used chicken broth only - no water added.
